triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: The paper addresses clustering of streaming data with imbalanced cluster distributions, which is a core application of cluster analysis techniques.

triples.name: Data stream clustering
triples.relevance: The paper directly tackles the problem of clustering streaming data with dynamic imbalance, a key challenge in data stream clustering.

triples.name: Self-Growth Map
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel Self-Growth Map that automatically arranges neurons on demand for fast and incremental adaptation to streaming data distributions.

triples.name: Self-organizing map
triples.relevance: The proposed Self-Growth Map (SGM) builds upon the self-organizing map concept, extending it for streaming data with adaptive neuron allocation.

triples.name: Hierarchical clustering
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a hierarchical merging strategy that combines neurons to identify true cluster boundaries in imbalanced distributions.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper is situated within machine learning as it addresses unsupervised learning for clustering patterns in data.

triples.name: Data mining
triples.relevance: Streaming data clustering is identified as a popular research topic in data mining, providing the broader research context.

triples.name: Streaming algorithm
triples.relevance: The proposed SOHI approach is designed as an incremental streaming algorithm to adapt to drifting cluster distributions in data chunks.
